keyFacts: American Express's Financial Intelligence Unit was actively gathering and sharing information about Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019.
The email indicates internal investigation and information sharing about Epstein within American Express's security and compliance departments.
The correspondence is dated shortly after Epstein's July 2019 arrest, suggesting financial institutions were reviewing his activities.
The document shows American Express had a designated Global Security contact (Robert Curran) for such matters.
The email contains confidentiality notices indicating the sensitive nature of the Epstein-related information.
